Perhaps it doesn't exist in the Mono for Android profile?" (#1532) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
# Visual Studio for Mac 7.4.2

Bootstrap a new application using File -> New -> Xamarin.Forms application -> iOS & Android application using defaults (which creates shared project architecture)

# iOS App

> Install-Package Microsoft.Azure.EventHubs

Compiles and works fine.

# Android

> Install-Package Microsoft.Azure.EventHubs

Does not compile, left with hot flaming ðŸ’£ 

```

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[api-xml-adjuster] Don't needlessly rebuild XML" (#1531) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Commit e3abe4b8 broke caching of the
`bin/Build$(Configuration)/api/api-*.xml.*` files, reintroducing the
scenario that commit 5c46ee39 fixed. The result is that *minutes* may
be spent needlessly re-generating API XML.

The cause of the breakage is that `@(_ApiParameterDescription)`
(introduced in e3abe4b8) will contain entries that we don't care
about, e.g. API-4, for which no longer generate bindings. As such, the
`_ClassParse` target Inputs were looking for files which will never
exist, thus causing the `_ClassParse` target to always execute.

Fix this by making `@(_ApiParameterDescription)` entries conditional
on the file `%(_ApiParameterDescription.ParameterDescription)` refers
to actually existing, and update `@(_ApiClassParseXml)` and
`@(_ApiAdjustedXml)` as well.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[Xamarin.Android.Build.Tasks] Try to speed up ConvertResourcesCases" (#1522) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
We currently call `ConvertResourcesCases` in three different places. [1], [2], [3]. For the most part they process the same files , over and over and over again. On a large project this is totally a waste of time. If the file has been processed once and not updated then we should not need to process it again.

So the only exception here is `GenerateJavaStubs`. The case here is this needs to be done AFTER we have compiled the app.. but we need to replace any instances of `Foo.MyClass` with `<md5hash>.MyClass` which is generated in the java code. So we do still need to process the resource files for the app after the main assembly has been built. 

That said if we know `UpdateAndroidResgen` has run, then we DONT need to run this again in `_CreateBaseApk`.

So this is an attempt to see if we can only process the files which have changed between each of those calls. Alternatively rework the targets so that we only have one call at the right place in the build system (probably as part of the `UpdateAndroidResources`)

If this does not work then the next task will be to rework the `AndroidResource.UpdateXmlResources` to NOT use `XDocument` but try to use `XPathDocument` or `XmlReader/Writer` instead since it is a streaming version and should be allot quicker. 

[1] https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/blob/5d64fb4bbad606eb4a3478085db0ca98616f9966/src/Xamarin.Android.Build.Tasks/Xamarin.Android.Common.targets#L1951
[2] https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/blob/5d64fb4bbad606eb4a3478085db0ca98616f9966/src/Xamarin.Android.Build.Tasks/Xamarin.Android.Common.targets#L1436
[3] https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/blob/5d64fb4bbad606eb4a3478085db0ca98616f9966/src/Xamarin.Android.Build.Tasks/Xamarin.Android.Common.targets#L2011

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[windows] fail the build if bundle download fails" (#1528) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
One of my biggest nightmares when developing for `xamarin-android` on
Windows, is noticing when I inadventently modified the hash for the
downloaded bundle, or check out a newer commit where the bundle is not
available yet. In cases where the bundle gets a 404, this is merely a
warning and the build continues on. This is a problem on Windows, since
it completely depends on the bundle download.

Depending on the state of your build tree, one of the following could
happen on Windows due to a failed bundle download:
- an `<Exec />` task fails, due to it trying to run `make`
- thousands of build errors on `Mono.Android.csproj` complaining about
missing `mscorlib` types

Explicitly failing the build on Windows, makes it a lot more clear what
is wrong. It also fails the build faster, freeing up development/build
agent time.

I used the `$(MSBuildLastTaskResult)` built-in property to check if the
`<DownloadUri />` task failed, even though it has
`ContinueOnError=True`. This is nice, because you get the 404 error
message as well as the newly added message.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[build] Cleanup; Non-redistributables in build-tools" (#1524) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Commit 0f0f7831 provided a handy guideline:

> General guideline for sanity (which we're breaking in a couple
> places, and should fix):
>
>   * `build-tools` is for things which will *not* be redistributed,
>     e.g. things which aren't part of the macOS `.pkg` or
>     Windows `.vsix`
>   * `src` and `tools` are for things which *will* be redistributed
>     as part of the SDK.

Finish this work: move `src/Xamarin.Android.Tools.BootstrapTasks` into
`build-tools/Xamarin.Android.Tools.BootstrapTasks`, as
`Xamarin.Android.Tools.BootstrapTasks.dll` is used as part of the
*xamarin-android* build system, and not used for building
*Xamarin.Android Apps*.

Additionally, the [xamarin-android-msbuild is broken][0]:

[0]: https://jenkins.mono-project.com/view/Xamarin.Android/job/xamarin-android-msbuild/854/

	Building target "_InstallMonoDoc" completely.
	...
	Task "Exec" (TaskId:81)
	  mono "â€¦/bin/BuildDebug/remap-assembly-ref.exe" "â€¦/external/mono/mcs/class/lib/monodroid_tools/mdoc.exe" "â€¦/bin/Debug/lib/xamarin.android/xbuild/Xamarin/Android/mdoc.exe" Mono.Cecil "../../bin/BuildDebug/Xamarin.Android.Cecil.dll" (TaskId:81)
	  Cannot open assembly 'â€¦/bin/BuildDebug/remap-assembly-ref.exe': No such file or directory. (TaskId:81)
	â€¦/src/mono-runtimes/mono-runtimes.targets(704,5): error MSB3073: The command "mono "â€¦/bin/BuildDebug/remap-assembly-ref.exe" "â€¦/external/mono/mcs/class/lib/monodroid_tools/mdoc.exe" "â€¦/bin/Debug/lib/xamarin.android/xbuild/Xamarin/Android/mdoc.exe" Mono.Cecil "../../bin/BuildDebug/Xamarin.Android.Cecil.dll"" exited with code 2. [â€¦/src/mono-runtimes/mono-runtimes.csproj]

This is *probably* fallout from commit 0f0f7831, as
`remap-assembly-ref.csproj` isn't being built, as it can't be *found*:

	Project reference "../remap-assembly-ref/remap-assembly-ref.csproj" has not been resolved. (TaskId:2)

Audit the directories moved in commit 0f0f7831 so that project
references are correct.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Maps]Xamarin.Forms.Maps not able to remove a pin on Android" (#2411) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues

### I'm using the latest Xamarin.Forms and Xamarin.Forms.Maps. I used map.Pins.Remove(myPin) to remove a pin in Google Map, which doesn't work at all. I have also tried custom render to remove the marker from map, which also doesn't work. I tried using native mono project to remove marker from map, it works well. Link to my [Xamarin.Forms demo](https://github.com/elvisxia/PinRemoveIssue).

### Steps to Reproduce

1.  Download the demo and build it.
2.  Click the button to remove the pin from map

### Expected Behavior
 Pin should be removed from map

### Actual Behavior
Pin is still there

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Memory Issue with Zebra TC56CJ devices running Android 6.0.1" (#2410) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description
Device: Zebra TC56CJ
Xamarin.Android App: Basic app with three buttons. Button 1 creates a new activity instance and finishes the current activity, button 2 does a minor collection, button 3 does a major collection. 

This device, when running a Xamarin.Android application, does not properly collect and dispose memory as we would expect. Some of the objects are eventually collected, after 2 - 3 minutes, but the memory never returns close to where it started. I've attached a profiler showing this. 

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Run the application on the specific device and start profiler 
2. Click on the "Start Activity" button 10 times 
3. See the increase in memory over time
4. Stop and wait several minutes, see GC running but the same amount of memory
5. Click the Major collect button a few times
6. Waited several minutes before seeing 1/3 of the memory collected but nowhere close to what it was before 

### Expected Behavior
- Expected memory to be collected after several seconds and after forcing a minor/major collection. We reproduced with a Samsung Galaxy S8 device that showed objects being collected properly. 

### Actual Behavior
- Had to wait several minutes without any memory collection happening. When we forced a memory collection, it took several minutes before we saw a slight dip in the memory usage.

### Basic Information

### Description of Change ###

These tests do not render properly when the linker is enabled on Android. Adding `Preserve` attributes to fix that.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[iOS] Grouped ListView will no longer crash when its ItemSource is cleared" (#2323) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###

Fixes issue where resetting a Grouped ListView on iOS can result in a crash due to an order of operations issue on the TIL. The best fix as always is to move the data into the container of the Cell itself and thus not have to touch the TIL.

### Bugs Fixed ###

Bug reported on Twitter and modified test 45125 to actually cover this case so we still have coverage.

### API Changes ###

None

### Behavioral Changes ###

Less crashy crash

### PR Checklist ###

- [ ] Has tests (if omitted, state reason in description)
- [ ] Rebased on top of master at time of PR
- [ ] Changes adhere to coding standard
- [ ] Consolidate commits as makes sense

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Can we detect the command line tools weren't installed?" (#3908) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
Problems occur when after downloading and using in the IDEs a new Xcode you didn't open it. I'm opening this issue to gather comments on how to address this, if only it's possible.

From Apple's [technical note](https://developer.apple.com/library/content/technotes/tn2339/_index.html#//apple_ref/doc/uid/DTS40014588-CH1-HOW_CAN_I_UNINSTALL_THE_COMMAND_LINE_TOOLS_) Xcode includes all of the command-line tools. If it is installed on your system, remove it to uninstall the command-line tools.

I tried completely removing Xcode and it didn't re-ask me to install the command line tools though.

However it's still possible there's something in the Xcode app bundle we could check.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "XMBindingSample fails to build with Xamarin.Mac 4.5.0.221 on Xcode 9.2 with "Full" profile and no linking" (#3906) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Install Xamarin.Mac 4.5.0.221 or build from https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/commit/256a3f57f1377fa7f86e0728abcbee6deb0c79ce
2. Open XMBinding Sample https://github.com/xamarin/mac-samples/blob/master/XMBindingExample/XMBindingExample/XMBindingExample.sln
3. Set Target to "Full" and set linker to Don't Link
4. Build the solution

### Expected Behavior

The build passes successfully

### Actual Behavior

The build fails with

```
error MM4162: The type 'BusinessChat.BCChatButtonStyle' (used as a parameter 
in BusinessChat.BCChatButton..ctor) is not available in macOS 10.13.2 (it was 
introduced in macOS 10.13.4). Please build with a newer macOS SDK 
(usually done by using the most recent version of Xcode).
```

It passes with Linker set to `Link Framework` and the error message does not suggest this action

Might be related to https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/commit/e19336b98fdb4741a366145e630332bcd2b9f1f7#diff-8cfea336cc7485e4438a02885718ea6a

Closed issue "ObjCRuntime.RuntimeException: Wrapper type 'BusinessChat.BCChatButton' is missing its native ObjectiveC class 'BCChatButton'" (#3903) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

I am using below code in ViewController of Xamarin.iOS app to add BCChatButton from iOS11.3 API

            BCChatButton businessChatButton = new BCChatButton(BCChatButtonStyle.Light);
            businessChatButton.TranslatesAutoresizingMaskIntoConstraints = false;
            View.AddSubview(businessChatButton);

Getting below exception. Please let me know how to resolve.

ObjCRuntime.RuntimeException: Wrapper type 'BusinessChat.BCChatButton' is missing its native ObjectiveC class 'BCChatButton'.

### Expected Behavior

Should show BCCChatButton

### Actual Behavior

Exception
